title: Recycling of Polyurethane Foam Takes a Step Forward - AZoCleantech
summary: Researchers at Aarhus University have developed a method to recycle polyurethane foam, a common material in mattresses, by breaking it down into its original components. This method allows for the reuse of polyol, a key component of polyurethane, in new mattresses, significantly reducing the amount of waste going to landfills. The researchers have successfully demonstrated that this process can be repeated multiple times, creating a more circular approach to polyurethane foam production.

title: Old Mattresses Made New: Simple Chemistry Can Recycle Polyurethane - Technology Networks
summary: Researchers at Aarhus University have developed a method called solvolysis to recycle flexible polyurethane foam, a common material used in mattresses. This process breaks down the foam into its original components, allowing for the extraction and reuse of polyol, a key component. This innovation has the potential to significantly reduce the amount of polyurethane waste that ends up in landfills.

title: Lush taps into the Barbie craze with a limited-edition collection - Premium beauty
summary: Lush Cosmetics has released a new product line in partnership with Barbie, featuring a range of personal and beauty care products in pink. The collection includes 'naked' products without packaging and products in packaging that are part of the company's closed-loop recycling program. The collection is designed to appeal to those who want to embrace pink and self-care.
